sections.purpose: To record electrical activity of the heart in experimental animals.
procedure: Connect the ECG leads to the appropriate limb or chest positions.
Ensure good electrode contact using conductive gel or clips.
Select the desired lead configuration and paper speed or screen settings.
Start recording before administering any test drug.
Administer the drug and continuously monitor ECG changes.
Save or print ECG tracings for analysis.
Disconnect electrodes and clean the animal and equipment.
precautions: Avoid electrical interference by proper grounding.
Check cables and electrodes for damage.
Use appropriate sedation or anesthesia to minimize movement artifacts.
Do not allow liquids to enter the instrument.
Follow animal ethics and welfare guidelines.
